title: No counterplay to Yas damage?
body: I just played a game as {{champion:122}} and got really fed and their midlane {{champion:157}} got really fed to the point where it was me carrying my team and him carrying his team. I built full armor items including {{item:3143}} and {{item:3075}}  until I had 322 armor. I was taking roughly 73% less physical damage and 10% less damage from crits. Now despite all of this {{champion:157}} was still doing roughly 15% of my health per auto which against a tank is utterly ridiculous. Because of his 100% crit chance I was basically negating 10% of his damage AND I had thornmail reflecting some of the damage back as well. So even when I've counter built as much as possible he's still able to shred through me so easily. And keep in mind we were both really fed so we had around about the same gold and this guy was able to 3 v 1 us so our only option was to try and catch him out with all 5 of us together and 5 v 1 him to actually kill him.

you need cc or as darius if you have an issue countering a yasou don't build a thornmail, your randulins will be more than enough. 
Instead buy more damage since you can actually kill a yasou pretty well if you can get up close to him and yasou is kinda of a tank-killer so he doesn't really take much damage from a thornmail since he doesn't stack atk speed and he relies on lifesteal so thornmail is not really going to help. 

I don't play darius but when I have to stop a fed yasou, I would want to maximise dueling power not tank stats. Also in ranked at low elo I don't care what people say cho'gath counters yasou trust me it works, so take cho'gath mid, take him jungle or take him top. If there is a lvl7 yasou on the enemy team you want to have a cho'gath, I don't care what mastery or elo, any semidecent cho'gath can easily keep a fed yasou in check. Top laners work against yasou because they generally can get up close to him without dying and then mop his face with huge damage and fighting power. Why do you think yasou's top counters are {{champion:92}} {{champion:31}} {{champion:122}} {{champion:105}} {{champion:2}} {{champion:80}}  when they build bruiser. Tank darius is not going to stop yasou, bruiser darius should be able to though.

I've played Darius vs Yasuo, and to be honest that was actually an even match up, I would say a yasuo with one or two kills would demolish a Darius regardless.  I wouldn't even say Darius is bursty per se because he has to actually land 5 autos or kill a target with his ult to maximize his output. I would say match up in Darius's favour if Yasuo didn't take warlords bloodlust. Now if Yasuo lets you hit him 5 times, that's a sure kill. 

And I've played Pantheon top and actually got 3 kills, enemy Yasuo also got 3 kills and I was actually killed by him even though I was sure that I should be able to burst kill him.  I don't know if it's a bug, but he i swear at one point yasuo took no damage from my heartseeker strike when he wind walled. :l

I would also put irelia with Jax up there for a counter to Yasuo since that really is a hard counter. Garen is also a good pick against Yasuo. 

Chogath's silence though really fucks with yasuo followed by his knock ups really facilitate ganks even when losing lane so that's always a plus.

yeah irelia and jax work pretty well as does renekton (this matchup is hilarious because there isn't much yasou can do except try not to push too hard or get close to renekton because renekton will then renekton all over his face and kill him). 

Early game Assassin junglers are also good for keeping yasou in check if they can put enough early lane pressure on because yasou relies quite a bit on going all in. Shaco is very good for dealing with yasou since yasou's tend to be pushed and since for shaco it's an easy camp and helps him snowball and yasou can't really handle falling behind, so basically it's a goodlane to camp early. Also the clone and popping a box down in the middle of the fight can be devastating for yasou, not to mention yasou won't really be able to outplay your e with windwall since you'll be in his face and so he wont have time to react so he has to kinda just throw windwall out and hope, whereas you can use e whenever you want.

My favourite yasou counter cho'gath generally won't win against yasou building full tank either. You want offtank, not full damage but maybe 1 or 2 tank items and the rest damage. You want to be able to get up close and wreck the squishy guys face. He's basically a melee, assassin fighter adc, so treat him as such and jump on his face cause he's not durable he just does alot of damage. Adc's can beat toplaners but you jump on their face and you'll win almost every time regardless of whether they're fed (unless it's vayne cause she'll condemn you).
